before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qu45","text":"Please read safety guidelines ahead of working with PFFs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9h3hp","text":"This protocol outlines methods used for the preparation of in vitro models for fluorescent imaging including primary rat and mouse hippocampal cultures treated with PFFs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

image_attribution: {"blocks":[{"key":"btob","text":"Maria Iuliano -60x image of rat hippocampal neurons (DIV28) after 7-day treatment with PFFs. Map2 (Blue) and phopsho-a-syn Ser129 (green)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"78sfi","text":"1% SDS for PFF inactivation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp10b","text":"4% PFA 4% sucrose in 1x PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehh3i","text":"1x PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pmlp","text":"ICC Buffer: 5% NGS in 1x PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch5gk","text":"ICC Blocking Buffer: 5% NGS 0.3% Triton-X in 1x PBS\\","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9topr","text":"Primary \u0026 secondary antibodies of choice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfeml","text":"Microscope slides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a5eo","text":"Forceps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dokpv","text":"Mounting medium of choice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eiv69","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qa15","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: An Efficient Procedure for Removal and Inactivation of Alpha-Synuclein Assemblies from Laboratory Materials.
references.authors: Bousset L, Brundin P, Böckmann A, Meier B, Melki R

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b37t7","text":"In a cell culture hood remove media and wash briefly with 1x PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99m4u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"j9a9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8a8n4","text":"Collect media and first wash as PFF waste for inactivation. Once in fixative, plate(s) can be moved to benchtop.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dpjsn","text":"  Fix using 4% PFA 4% sucrose in 1xPBS with gentle rocking/shaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e4377","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"mu4a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"20","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"91qjm","text":"Check whether the antibodies you intend to use require specific fixation. Optimization may be needed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nt22","text":"  Wash 1x PBS. Repeat 3 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"78mdg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e5b8a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"20-30","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eqkrv","text":"Pause Point: Coverslips can be stored after fixation for up to 2 weeks (or maybe more), though immediate processing is ideal. Store at 4C away from light, with the plate wrapped in parafilm to reduce evaporation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brvc2","text":"  Block in blocking buffer (5% NGS, 0.3% Triton-X in 1x PBS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"20-30","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":33}}}}

Dilutions may need to be optimized to individual needs.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Antibody","Company","Catalog #"],["Gephyrin","Synaptic Systems","147111"],["HA (HA-tag)","BioLegend","901513"],["HA (HA-tag)","Cell Signaling","3724"],["Homer","Synaptic Systems\u0026nbsp;","160003"],["MAP2","Millipore","AB5543"],["MAP2","Millipore\u0026nbsp;","MAB364"],["Neurofilament","Millipore","AB5539"],["Phospho-α-syn (Ser129)","Biolegend","825701"],["VGAT","Synaptic Systems","131003"],["VGLUT1","Millipore\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;","AB5905"]],"rowHeights":[31,26,23,18,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"tables"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9h3rj","text":"  Incubate in solution containing secondary antibodies diluted in 5% NGS in 1x PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cplcp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9pd0g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"56628012243111EFBB660A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"20","start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2cve9","text":"Secondary incubation can vary (up to O/N), but typically 2-3hr at 4C works well. 1hr at RT can also work, though it may result in excess background signal, depending on the antibody","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"77ld1","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cd2pp","text":"Typically, we use Alexa Fluor secondaries from Life Technologies, except for anti-chicken CF 405 (Millipore SAB4600466).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ehd1p","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"agt3b","text":"When working with PFFs, it is best to follow proper safety precautions and wear appropriate PPE, including lab coat, gloves, sleeve guards, safety glasses or face shield, and N95 or FFP2 mask.
